headline.print_headline: Auriemma Isn’t Interested In Coaching 2016 Olympians
headline.seo: Auriemma Isn’t Interested in Coaching 2016 Olympians
headline.main: Auriemma Isn’t Interested in Coaching 2016 Olympians

docs.snippet: Connecticut Coach Geno Auriemma, who led the United States to its fifth consecutive Olympic gold in women’s basketball in London, said he had no interest in returning as coach of the national team for the 2016 Olympics....
docs.lead_paragraph: Connecticut Coach Geno Auriemma, who led the United States to its fifth consecutive Olympic gold in women’s basketball in London, said he had no interest in returning as coach of the national team for the 2016 Olympics.

docs.snippet: Mitt Romney’s transition team has been working since June, offering a glimpse into what his approach to governing might be....

headline.print_headline: California Team Wins In Little League Series

headline.main: California Team Wins in Little League Series

docs.snippet: Bradley Smith struck out seven and went 4 for 4 at the plate, and Petaluma, Calif., held on for a 6-4 victory over Fairfield, Conn., in the Little League World Series....
docs.abstract: Teams from Petaluma, Calif, Tokyo and Goodlettsville, Tenn, are winners at the Little League World Series.
docs.lead_paragraph: Bradley Smith struck out seven and went 4 for 4 at the plate, and Petaluma, Calif., held on for a 6-4 victory over Fairfield, Conn., in the Little League World Series.

headline.print_headline: Karl Fleming Dies at 84; Covered Civil Rights Era as Reporter
headline.seo: Karl Fleming, Reporter Who Covered Civil Rights, Dies at 84
headline.main: Karl Fleming, Reporter Who Covered Civil Rights Era, Dies at 84

docs.snippet: As a Newsweek reporter, Mr. Fleming dodged bullets and choked on tear gas while covering some of the most momentous events of the civil rights era....
docs.lead_paragraph: As a Newsweek reporter, Mr. Fleming dodged bullets and choked on tear gas while covering some of the most momentous events of the civil rights era.

headline.print_headline: Brewers End Losing Streak With a Late Grand Slam
headline.seo: Braves’ Chipper Jones Homers Twice Against Padres
headline.main: Braves’ Jones Shows Power of His Past, Homering Twice

docs.snippet: Chipper Jones homered twice on a night when a big crowd turned out to get his bobblehead, and the Atlanta Braves won their 15th straight game with Kris Medlen as a starter....
docs.abstract: Baseball Roundup; Milwaukee Brewers defeat the Philadelphia Phillies, 4-1; other baseball news and results noted.
docs.lead_paragraph: Chipper Jones homered twice on a night when a big crowd turned out to get his bobblehead, and the Atlanta Braves won their 15th straight game with Kris Medlen as a starter.
